TopicTitle: Is there an RCS throttle control?

Articles.Content: For some of my crafts I am finding that I need more fine tuned control of my RCS thrust. Is there a variable force RCS thruster available or a way to globally modify the RCS thrust similar to that of the rocket thrust control?

RCS module thrust power is adjustable in it\'s CFG file. There isn\'t a throttle for it in KSP yet.

Hope this helps!
Yeah, thats kinda what I was expecting to hear. I guess I just need to hope .16 brings adjustable RCS thrust on the fly.
You can also select 'Precise Controls' to cut the thrust used by RCS. It helps a lot in fine movement for RV and landing.
I have forward RCS set to one of my throttles on my joystick.
P.S. The Fine Controls is by default toggled by the CapsLock key. You know it\'s activated when the pitch/roll/yaw indicators in the bottom left change from orange sliders to blue.
